refnamediv.refpurpose: Displays images in the Scilab graphic window

varlistentry.listitem: A string, the image filename to be created. The extension determines the type of the image.
MxN matrix, a grayscale (0-1 range) or pseudo-color/indexed (1-Ncolors range) image.
A scalar, the number of levels of gray to display Img. 1x2 array corresponding to the grayscale range to be considered.
1x2 array corresponding to the grayscale range to be considered.
Mx3 matrix containing the image colormap (for indexed images). Entries may range from 0 to 1

this is used to e.g. put axes around your image. See the plot2d help page. You may use this optional parameter in the assignment style, as in
imshow(img,strf='041') // same as imshow but draw axes
displays Img using n gray levels. Img is an MxN matrix in 0 - (n-1) range. If n is omitted, it will be assumed to be 256.

displays Img using a grayscale within the specified range. Elements <= low will map onto black, Elements >= high will map onto white, and elements in between will map as a shade of gray. If an empty matrix '[]' is used, [low,high] will be assumed to be [min(Img), max(Img)].
displays Img using the specified colormap.
displays the RGBImg MxNx3 (0-1) truecolor image.
displays the image filename in the scilab graphical window. Any raster image format is accepted (see Remarks section).

refsection.title: Examples

refentry.refsection: Remarks In theory, imshow(filename) will work with any raster image format. In practice, it has been tested only for BMP, GIF, JPEG, PNG, PCX, TIFF, XPM, and MIFF. Displaying other file formats will probably work, but this case have not been tested by the developers of the SIP toolbox.

refsection.title: Bugs and Shortcomings
refsection.para: The display of truecolor images is somewhat inefficient.
Images are stored in double precision matrices. Hopefully, the next release will make usage of integer types.
